heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 16.6mm per hour was the peak rain rate recorded today ranking 2nd in our overall records.  The storm lasted 3.2 hours and 5.69mm of rain fell.  The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting 26 August 2025, is ranked 4th among the longest rainy periods since 23 September 2024.  It has lasted 10 days so far.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwave.  This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves happen every year.

tropical: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (196°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.0°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 10%) and rainfall (down 1.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 1.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 2.0°C), inside temperature (up 1.7°C), outside temperature (up 1.5°C), and cloud levels (up 699 m) when compared to today.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 565m to 1838m and averaged 1913.0m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and little or no wind. Light to moderate rain is forecast, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and very bright daylight. Weather could become unsettled.
